The weather bureau forecasts above-average rainfall across the east coast in coming months, which is good for some farmers and challenging for others.

title.children: Bumper grain crop likely as 'unusually high' spring rain forecast

image.altText: Warren Tredrea walks outside court.

props.synopsis: A court orders ex-footballer and sports presenter Warren Tredrea to pay $149,000 to cover legal costs that were accumulated by his former employer, Channel Nine, during part of the long-running court battle between the parties.

title.children: Tredrea ordered to pay $149k for Channel Nine's legal costs

image.altText: An elderly woman in a stripe knit top in a dark room with timber cabinets

props.synopsis: Hallucinations are synonymous with mental illness, but a condition affecting the vision impaired community has been under-reported and under-diagnosed.

title.children: Rare condition of visual hallucinations affects people with vision impairment

image.altText: A serious Matthew Nicks talks to his players during a break in a game. He is bald and is wearing a multi-coloured tee.

props.synopsis: Adelaide fans are threatening to cancel their memberships after a Collingwood star was targeted during the AFL qualifying final.

title.children: 'I felt ashamed': Crows fans hit out at homophobic slurs during QF

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a black tshirt is kneeling down and patting a dog.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the missing remains found by a member of the public in scrubland east of Port Lincoln are that of alleged murder victim Julian Story. Warning: This story contains content some readers may find distressing.

title.children: Testing confirms alleged murder victim's remains, police say

image.altText: A woman holding a pregnancy test.

props.synopsis: A renewed push to change South Australia's pregnancy termination laws is set to be introduced to the state's parliament, with an independent MP proposing to place significant new restrictions on abortion access.

title.children: New push to change South Australian abortion laws

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal women stand and sit around a large painting in the desert.

props.synopsis: Smithy Zimran died before he could realise his dream of receiving dialysis on country, but his legacy lives on.

title.children: Remote community celebrates anniversary of dialysis breakthrough

image.altText: Education Minister Blair Boyer talking to a reporter

props.synopsis: South Australia's Education Minister believes there is more work to be done to boost safeguards within the childcare sector. He says well-trained staff would be the key to preventing "shocking things happening to kids".

title.children: SA education minister says childcare staff key to preventing âshockingâ incidents

image.altText: GettyImages-2232975247

props.synopsis: Magpies player Isaac Quaynor says he tried to block out the noise after Crows fans booed him during their qualifying final clash.

title.children: Crows coach deflects questions about fans booing Pies slur victim

image.altText: A cartoon character screenshot from the video game hollow knight silksong

props.synopsis: After years of silence, Team Cherry has released their sequel to one of the most successful Australian-made games of all time, which is expected to break records.

title.children: Australian-made Hollow Knight: Silksong crashes global stores on launch

image.altText: Smoke about the Lucindale grass fire

props.synopsis: A judge finds that vegetation heaps lit on fire by grazier Tom Brinkworth burned for six months before causing a bushfire that destroyed three houses.Â

title.children: Supreme Court rules late pastoralist's actions led to SA bushfire

image.altText: People in suit jackets outside court.

props.synopsis: Prominent Melbourne property investor Adrian Portelli pleads not guilty in an Adelaide court to 19 charges relating to allegations he was running "unlawful lotteries in South Australia".

title.children: Adrian Portelli blames illegal lotteries trial on 'big miscommunication'

image.altText: A middle-aged man with a light, grey beard wears high-vis as he holds leaves hanging from a tree in his hands.

props.synopsis: Producers and beekeepers had been expecting the arrival of the parasite. Now they are bracing for impact.

title.children: Uncertainty for SA communities after first varroa mite detection

image.altText: composite image of Vincent Tarzia on a stage, Troy Bell outdoors

props.synopsis: With the departure of Troy Bell this week, the South Australian Liberal Party had its sights set on finally winning a by-election. Instead, they were reminded of their 28-year political nightmare.

title.children: Mad Monday beers, a UK theatre fan and a 28-year Liberal Party nightmare

image.altText: A close up photo shows the face of Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: China's display of an array of naval weaponry and assets, as opposed to land-based ones, could hardly have been less subtle.

title.children: As a new world order dawns, Australia plods along, much to scholars' dismay

image.altText: Troy Bell looks serious while being filmed in camera

props.synopsis: Former South Australian MP Troy Bell, who was previously found guilty of serious fraud charges, is also facing a raft of deception allegations, it can be revealed.

title.children: Former SA MP charged over alleged misuse of accommodation allowance

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in front of a screen and waves.

props.synopsis: Tesla's board has proposed a $US1 trillion ($1.52 trillion) compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk in what would be the largest corporate pay package in history.

image.altText: Hegseth stands behind Trump, Trump is blurred

props.synopsis: Pete Hegseth belongs to a church founded by a man who believes that women should not have the right to vote. And a new church outpost has just opened a few blocks from the Capitol building.Â

title.children: US secretary of defense's arch-conservative faith comes into view

image.altText: Molly Wilkes with her mother Julie Adams.

props.synopsis: Perpetrators of domestic violence and financial abuse can gain access to the superannuation benefits and life insurance proceeds of their victims. A parliamentary inquiry finds super laws should be changed to prevent it continuing.

title.children: The 'shocking' loophole allowing some abusers to profit from partners' deaths

image.altText: A brown snake sticking its head out from under blankets

props.synopsis: A near-fatal bite was not enough to stop Queenslander Kasey Leadbetter from loving snakes but she says treatment could be improved, and researchers agree.

title.children: Nanny bitten by brown snake while sleeping calls for improved treatments

image.altText: Vladimir Putin, Xi Jinping, and Kim Jong Un walk in tandem, flanked by entourage.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin and Xi Jinping were caught on an audio recording talking about organ transplants extending life â but there are plenty of biotech startups also looking at increasing human life span, particularly in the US, where many are supported by powerful billionaires.

title.children: Putin and Xi's chat about immortality has parallels to biotech startups

image.altText: A man in work clothes, wearing a cap and leaning on against an off-road vehicle.

props.synopsis: The trial of celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright unearthed a culture of helicopter maintenance and safety breaches by his company, which some say have been ongoing in Australia's north for decades.

title.children: Cowboy helicopter culture exposed by Matt Wright trial

image.altText: a view of St Patrick's Catholic cathedral in East Melbourne

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation can reveal the Catholic Church tried to revive a highly controversial legal loophole that stopped it from being sued by victims of sexual abuse for millions of dollars in damages, after it was scrapped in 2018.

title.children: Catholic Church tried to revive outlawed legal loophole in abuse case

image.altText: Chalmers gestures while sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: This week in Canberra the government seemed to be getting cold feet on its superannuation tax plan and the Coalition reckoned Labor was being less than transparent.

title.children: Is Labor getting cold feet on its superannuation tax plan?

image.altText: man with blurred face

props.synopsis: A 62-year-old man is arrested and charged after allegedly having 35 kilograms of methamphetamine, worth an estimated $11 million, in his luggage at Brisbane Airport.

title.children: Man arrested at airport after allegedly hiding $11m of meth in luggage

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: The "world's worst" honey bee parasite, varroa mite, has been detected in South Australia for the first time. Now in five jurisdictions across Australia, what impact will it have on the agricultural industry?

title.children: A honey bee-killing parasite is in SA for the first time. What impact will it have?

image.altText: A man wearing a navy button-up top with a shaved head in front of a grey backdrop

props.synopsis: Hamas has released a video showing Israeli hostages Guy Gilboa-Dalal and Alon Ohel, who were captured during the militant group's October 7, 2023, attack.Â

title.children: Hamas releases video showing Israeli hostages

image.altText: Donald Trump holds up a signed document.

props.synopsis: The move is the latest step in Donald Trump's efforts to rebrand the US military, including by presiding over an extraordinary military parade in downtown Washington DC, and restoring the original names of military bases that were changed after racial justice protests in 2020.

title.children: Trump changes Department of Defense's name to Department of War

image.altText: Tennis star Jannik Sinner looks up at his coaches and clenches his fist in celebration at the US Open.

props.synopsis: It's a Carlos Alcaraz vs Jannik Sinner final for the third straight major, as the world number one advances after a tougher-than-expected challenge from Canada's Felix Auger-Aliassime.

title.children: It's Sinner vs Alcaraz again in the US Open final

image.altText: Two women standing beside a man in front of a tram talking to each other

props.synopsis: Melbourne's best tram drivers are getting ready for a trip to Vienna to compete in the inaugural World Tramdriver Championship.

title.children: Cheers and skittles for tram drivers on track for world championships

image.altText: The exteriorÂ of the Don Dale Youth Detention Centre, with barbed wire in the foreground.

props.synopsis: An Aboriginal child was held in a solitary cell for more than three days and denied food and medication as a coercion "strategy", an investigation into the NT's notorious Don Dale youth prison has found.

title.children: Child held in solitary cell for three days, denied food and medications

image.altText: Two women and a young boy sitting in a stadium, surrounded by other people.

props.synopsis: Buckingham Palace announces Katharine, Duchess of Kent â who once had a secret job as a primary school music teacher â died on Thursday evening.

title.children: Oldest member of British royal family, who once had secret job, dead at 92

image.altText: A painting of a green valley with shrubs on the side and a mountain in the background, in an ornate gold frame.g

props.synopsis: Russian artist Nicholas Chevalier's now-famous painting of Mt Abrupt in western Victoria is being used by a revegetation group to reflect the landscape as the artist saw it in 1864.

title.children: Clues in 161-year-old painting help restore Grampians' native beauty

image.altText: A smiling, middle-aged man smiles while he takes a selfie with a girl, whose face is blurred.

props.synopsis: When Andrew Burow went missing from his Brisbane unit, it sparked an investigation full of twists and turns.

title.children: What we know about the mysterious disappearance of Andrew Burow

image.altText: A diagram of two frogs, one with tadpoles in it's belly, and another with a frog in it's mouth.

props.synopsis: Nearly two decades ago, scientists in Newcastle came surprisingly close to resurrecting the extinct gastric brooding frog. Their failure highlights issues still plaguing de-extinction research today.

title.children: How a team of Australian scientists almost brought back an extinct frog
